meanings.def: based on general ideas and not on any particular real person, thing or situation
examples: The research shows that pre-school children are capable of thinking in abstract terms.
Abstract principles are no good in this particular situation.
All human beings are capable of thinking in abstract terms.

meanings.def: existing in thought or as an idea but not having a physical reality
examples: We may talk of beautiful things but beauty itself is abstract.
Mathematics is an extremely abstract discipline.
Some of the ideas that their legal system is based on are incredibly abstract.
Freedom is more than a purely abstract notion.

meanings.def: not representing people or things in a realistic way, but expressing the artist’s ideas about them
examples: the work of American abstract expressionists like Mark Rothko
Kandinsky’s first pure abstracts are marked by their wild colour.

meanings.def: a short piece of writing containing the main ideas in a document
examples: Abstracts of about 300 words should be submitted to the conference committee who will decide which papers to accept.
This information is supplementary to the abstract of accounts.

meanings.def: in a general way, without referring to a particular real person, thing or situation
examples: Legal questions rarely exist in the abstract; they are based on real cases.
I’m just talking in the abstract now.

idioms.def: in a general way, without referring to a particular real person, thing or situation
examples: Legal questions rarely exist in the abstract; they are based on real cases.
I’m just talking in the abstract now.
She abstracted the main points from the argument.
Their plan is to abstract 8 million gallons of water from the river.

meanings.def: to make a written summary of a book, etc.
